arts.ttl: Celtic vs Sturm Graz – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: Celtic will be desperate to secure their first Europa League victory of the campaign when they host Austrian champions Sturm Graz at Celtic Park on Thursday evening. Both sides will be looking to climb the Europa League standings, with Celtic currently languishing in 28th position while Sturm Graz occupy 22nd place after two matchdays. arts.ttl: Celtic vs Sturm Graz – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Celtic will aim to claim their maiden Europa League win of the season when they welcome Austrian titleholders Sturm Graz to Celtic Park on Thursday night. arts.ttl: “I hoped we’d play Celtic away. The draw was kind. I’m incredibly excited,” Emir Karic
arts.sum: SK Sturm Graz defender Emir Karic revealed that he will be living out a childhood dream by playing at Celtic Park this evening, describing the venue as having one of the most electric atmospheres in Europe… Celtic continue their Europa League journey tonight as they face the Austrian champions in their third group stage match. arts.sum: Kilmarnock FC today confirmed the signing of goalkeeper Tobi Oluwayemi on an emergency seven-day loan from Celtic, while Daizen Maeda has been ruled out of Celtic’s Europa League match against SK Sturm Graz… The 22-year-old London-born shot-stopper came through the youth systems at Tottenham Hotspur before joining Celtic. arts.ttl: “Celtic stronger than Rangers” – Sturm Graz player explains what he’s thinking
arts.sum: Rangers lost 2-1 to Sturm Graz at the beginning of October. Another lost match in a miserable period for the Ibrox club. After the Austrian club went ahead in the Europa League tie, Djeidi Gassama scored an equaliser but Rangers ultimately lost. Celtic now welcome Sturm Graz and there’s obviously. arts.ttl: Celtic ‘dream’ revealed by Sturm Graz player – Sounds a bit too much of a Celtic fan
arts.sum: Sturm Graz’s Emir Karić says he was thrilled when he found about facing Celtic in the Europa League. Brendan Rodgers’ side host the Austrian club at Celtic Park this week, and this fixture has got the 28-year-old excited. Ahead of the Celtic clash, Wednesday’s edition of Kleine Zeitung has an interview with Karić.
